author: Brian Chapman
text:
Hello everyone,
I am posting to the Knowledge Network on behalf of a UW-O Graduate Student looking for information on time off policies. If you could please post your answers on the forum before April 5th, I would appreciate it. You may also send your reply to him directly, if you would prefer that. His email is below.
Thanks
Hello – My name is Robert Schipper. I am a graduate student at UW-Oshkosh in the Master’s of Public Administration program enrolled in the Public Policy Analysis class. Municipalities can ask our professor, Dr. Karl Nollenberger, for an analysis of a policy that could be under evaluation. My group’s analysis is of the Village of Winneconne’s (pop. 2,500) time off policy. Winneconne would like us to compare to other similar municipalities as to what their time off policies are. Would you be able to share your time off policy with us by answering the following questions?

What is the equalized value of your municipality?
What is your current population?
Number of employees (full-time and part-time)?
Job classifications of employees (i.e. – police, DPW, administration)?
What kind of time off is allowed (vacation, sick, holiday, military, funeral)?
Traditional time off policy (multiple banks) or paid time off (all under one bank)?
What are the accrual rates?
How much can be accumulated?
Can unused time be carried over to the next year?
Is there any short term or long term disability offered, and if yes, please explain?
How much can be paid out upon employee separation?
Has there been any changes in the past five years to the time off policy and what were they?
If there were any changes, how were they received by the employees?
Is there any other information that you think should be included?
What do you estimate is the value of your time-off policy per employee is in dollars?
Thank-you for your time in this analysis. If you have any questions regarding this, I can be reached at (schipr61@uwosh.edu). Please reply by April 5, 2014.
Robert Schipper
title: Time Off Policies
